They are entering a dynamic phase of expansion with numerous upcoming projects on the horizon. As they set ambitious growth targets for the next 12-18 months, we're actively seeking talented Field Service Engineers to join their team. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of their journey during this period of rapid growth and contribute to the success of their ambitious plans.
Role OverviewAs a Field Service Engineer, you will play a critical role in providing technical support to their partner manufacturing businesses. You will be responsible for diagnosing and troubleshooting mechanical and electrical issues with CNC (Computer Numerical Control) equipment, ensuring minimal downtime and maximum productivity. The ideal candidate will have strong technical proficiency in mechanical and electrical engineering, with specific expertise in CNC maintenance. Excellent communication skills are essential as you will interact directly with clients and collaborate with internal teams to deliver effective solutions.
Responsibilities:Respond promptly to service requests from partner manufacturing businesses, either remotely or by conducting on-site visits.Diagnose and troubleshoot mechanical and electrical issues with CNC equipment, including but not limited to machine tools, controllers, and automation systems.Utilize volt meters, perform machine diagnostics, interpret wiring diagrams, and assess control systems to identify and resolve technical problems effectively.Collaborate with internal teams to develop and implement solutions, ensuring the smooth operation of partner equipment and processes.Provide technical guidance and support to clients, offering recommendations for preventive maintenance and equipment optimization.Document service activities, including findings, solutions implemented, and recommendations for future improvements.Stay updated on industry trends and technological advancements in CNC equipment and related systems.
Qualifications:Qualified Degree or equivalent experience in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field.Proven experience in CNC maintenance and troubleshooting, with a strong understanding of mechanical and electrical principles.Proficiency in using volt meters, interpreting wiring diagrams, and conducting machine diagnostics.Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts clearly to clients and internal stakeholders.Strong problem-solving abilities, with a proactive and systematic approach to diagnosing and resolving technical issues.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities effectively.Willingness to travel to client sites for on-site support as needed.
Additional - SalaryPlease note because this business is at an early growth phase, we don't want to miss out on applicants by posting a salary banding, we want to get an understanding of the market rates so if this role looks of interest please apply and we can set up an initial conversation to discuss further.

title: Content Specialist
company_name: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center
description:
The Senior Content Specialist plans, coordinates, writes and produces national reputation advertising content, executive communications (both internal and external), print materials, and content for digital, interactive, social and other emerging communication technologies to advance the Ohio State Wexner Medical Center brand and reputation. The Senior Content Specialist interacts constantly with appropriate Medical Center leaders and serves as a point person for Marketing and Strategic Communications colleagues for producing, editing and proofreading content for their client departments and projects. Superior written and video storytelling abilities are required. This position is responsible for not only planning and creating high-quality content, but also distributing it through various communication channels – traditional, interactive, social and emerging technologies – and optimizing its findability and shareability by web-based search engines and across digital channels. In addition, this position may be assigned to lead various ad hoc committees and work teams involving other Medical Center faculty and staff, department team members, graphic designers, photographers, videographers, web developers and user-experience designers both in-house and freelance.
Organizational ExpectationsThe Senior Content Specialist for the Content team practices within the Medical Center's policies and procedures and adheres to the Medical Center’s values as demonstrated through positive patient/guest relations, positive and effective interactions with faculty, staff, and the formulating and meeting of personal development goals. In support of the Medical Center’s strategic goals, this person works closely with individuals at all levels of the organization and community and, therefore, must conduct himself/herself with the utmost professionalism in all interactions. Further, finished projects managed by the Senior Content Specialist directly affect the image of the Medical Center among its key constituent groups and must be accurate, consistent, high-quality and free from errors of any kind.
Minimum Education Requirements Bachelor’s degree in journalism, English or related communications field or equivalent experience. Required QualificationsBachelor’s degree in journalism, English or related communications field or equivalent experience. Minimum of 6 years of proven experience in communications, public relations or related field. Strong knowledge of effective digital storytelling techniques. Experience writing/producing and publishing content within a content management system and social media channels. Strong problem-solving, writing, editing and proofreading skills essential. Must have excellent verbal communication skills as well as presentation and negotiation skills.
Additional Desired QualificationsFamiliarity with photography, video, printing, budget management and content analytics preferred.

description:

title: Auto Glass Installation Technician Trainee
description:
Does this position interest you? You should apply – even if you don’t match every single requirement! We're known as an auto glass company. That's the focus of what we do. But beyond the glass, we're so much more. We'll help you build a fulfilling career and encourage you to have a life. Let us be the best place you'll ever work.

Do you like to be challenged? Have natural mechanical ability? Work independently, but also as part of a team with opportunities for growth and advancement?

Join Safelite as an Auto Glass Technician Trainee — the first step in becoming a certified auto glass technician on a nationally recognized team of expert installers! We’ll train you to install and repair auto glass, recalibrate car safety systems and provide service so great, it’s memorable. And you’ll get paid to learn it all!

We’re more than just a glass company. We empower our associates with the support they need to be efficient, to problem-solve and have an eye for detail, and most importantly, to deliver quality service and bring a little unexpected happiness to people’s lives.

This isn’t your typical desk job! You’ll be outdoors, working with your hands, and yes, that means working in an ever-changing environment with all sorts of weather conditions.

It’s time to start that new career you’ve been thinking about. Invest in yourself and learn more about our 3-month paid training program. Once on the job, your pay is evaluated every six months to ensure you’re rewarded for outstanding performance!

As a Technician Trainee you will: 

Be paid to learn and apprentice the Safelite way, through hands-on and classroom training, including:Installing and repairing auto glassRecalibrating automotive safety systemsProviding additional services & productsStudy and pass testing to become a Safelite-certified Technician showing proficiency in installations, embracing a positive attitude and following taught techniques.Safely operate a company vehicle and company-issued tools utilized throughout the workday.

What you’ll get:

Competitive weekly pay starting at $20.75/hour, increasing to $22.50/hour after training and certification.Earn $5/set of wiper blades when added for customer safety.Potential to be promoted in your first year! Pay starting at $25.00/hour as a Senior Tech & $28.75/hour as a Master Tech. Technician career levels determined based on performance metrics demonstrating efficiency, quality, and customer satisfaction.A benefits package valued at more than $10k*. Includes 401(k) plan with company matching, medical plans, paid time off, holidays & volunteer days.Program to buy additional PTO or sell unused time up to 16 hours.Up to $5,250 annually in tuition reimbursement.Paid training and all the tools and resources you'll need to be successful.View all our health, wealth, and life offerings at www.safelitebenefits.com.

What you’ll need: (Not sure if you meet all the requirements? We encourage you to apply!)

Must be 18 years of age or olderValid state-issued driver’s license requiredComfortable working outside (in a wide variety of weather conditions) on your feet for extended periodsAbility to work scheduled days, with flexibility on start and end times to accommodate customer’s needsAbility to regularly lift up to 35 pounds and occasionally lift up to 50 poundsHigh school diploma/GED/equivalent preferred; ability to read & write

title: Safety Lead – Assurance and Promotion
description:
At the MBTA, we envision a thriving region enabled by a best-in-class transit system. Our mission is to serve the public by providing safe, reliable, and accessible transportation. MBTA’s core values are built around safety, service, equity, and sustainability and each employee that works for the MBTA performs their roles based on our vision, mission, and values. This includes attendance, participation, and contribution in local safety committee meetings as needed.

Job Summary

The Safety Lead is responsible for assisting the Deputy Director of Safety Assurance and Promotion and the Director of SMS and Safety Oversight in designing, implementing, and monitoring the Authority's safety programs, policies, and procedures. This position will recommend feasible corrective action plans to improve safety programs, policies, and procedures.

These major initiatives include but are not limited to Internal Safety Audits, Employee Reporting Programs, Hazard Tracking, Corrective Action Plan development, Safety Management System (SMS) implementation, Safety Rules Compliance, Field Audits, and Hazard Follow-up. Implementation of these initiatives is accomplished through collaboration with and mentorship of the Safety Assurance Team, as well as coordination with internal MBTA departments and external regulators, including the Department of Public Utilities (DPU) and the Federal Transit Administration (FTA).

Duties & Responsibilities

Act as the subject matter expert, overseeing the performance of safety activities, conduct assessments of safety programs, including field inspections, procedure, and policy reviews to identify areas of improvements and corrective actions. Update policies and procedures as necessary to improve safety.Act as a team lead by guiding and mentoring team members to achieve their goals.Collaborate with the Deputy Director of Safety Assurance and Promotion to establish and implement team strategies and work plans.Run team meetings and facilitate open communication between team members.Monitor team performance and provide feedback to team members to improve their skills and productivity.Assist the Deputy Director of Safety Assurance and Promotion in coordinating team activities, delegating tasks, and ensuring timely completion of projects.Mentor members of the Assurance and Promotion team to ensure completion of assigned tasks,Will ensure the implementation of the SMS initiative per regulatory mandates.Act as the process lead on the annual Internal Safety Audit Program to ensure MBTA departments adhere to the responsibilities outlined in the MBTA Safety Plan. A minimum of three departments must be audited each year, and all MBTA departments that conduct safety-related activities must be audited at least once every three years.Prepare, edit, and disseminate monthly reports as needed covering topics such as the status of projects and initiatives, CAP status, Field Audits, Hazard Reporting.Assist in creating, coordinating with appropriate departments and regulators, tracking, and closing Corrective Action Plans with the DPU, including ensuring that all related documentation is assembled and preserved.Assist in the development, assembly, follow-up investigations, and tracking of hazard data in the MBTA Hazard Tracking Log.Write, investigate, manage, and review safety assessments.Act independently and proactively to conduct assurance activities, including continuous monitoring of open hazards, CAPS, employee safety reports, and more.Act as a team lead and assist the Deputy Director of Safety Assurance and Promotion in managing, mentoring, and developing members of the Safety Assurance Team.Act as the lead for Safety Risk Mitigation processes.Assist the Deputy Director of Safety Assurance and Promotion in managing all open projects.Serve as a subject-matter expert and resource to outside business units on processes including Safety Risk Management and Safety Assurance.Suggest and develop improvements to existing processes and procedures as it refers to Safety Assurance and Promotion.Collaborate with other Safety Teams.Work may include weekend shifts with the ability to work any shift (1st, 2nd, or 3rd) assigned.Perform all other duties and projects that may be assigned.


Minimum Requirements & Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Safety, Urban Planning, Public Administration, Business, or related fieldSix (6) years of experience in the transit industry, regulatory compliance, Safety Assurance, data analysis and/or program auditingKnowledge/understanding of 49 CFR Parts 672, (Public Transportation Safety and 673 (Public Transportation Agency Safety Plan (PTASP)Demonstrated experience applying methods and techniques to mitigate safety issues by assessing safety hazards and ensuring corrective measures are followed.Experience applying safety knowledge through the facilitating and processing of safety programs and assessments.Effective organizational, analytical, confidentiality, quantitative, multi-tasking and time management skillsAdvanced skill-level in the use of Word, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, PeopleSoft and/or other database applicationsHandle sensitive and confidential information in an appropriate manner.Have excellent customer service, conflict resolution, negotiation, communication, speaking and writing skills.Have a valid driver's license.Ability to work all shifts and/or locations as assigned or directed; be available to work twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week.Ability to complete, apply, and adhere to concepts in safety training including but not limited to SMS Fundamentals, ICS 200, 200, 300, 400, 700, and 800 as well as courses offered on websites hosted by MassDOT, FEMA, and TSI within the first month of employment. Ability to complete a Public Transportation Safety Certification Training Program (PTSCTP) within three (3) years of employment.Have excellent customer service and conflict resolution skills.


Substitutions Include

A High School Diploma or GED with an additional seven (7) years of directly related experience substitutes for the bachelor’s degree requirement.An associate degree from an accredited institution an additional three (3) years of directly related experience substitutes for the bachelor’s degree requirement.A master’s degree in a related subject substitute for two (2) years of general experience.A nationally recognized certification, or statewide/professional certification in a related field substitutes for one year of experience


Preferred Experience and Required Skills

A master’s degree in safety, Urban Planning, Business or Public Administration.Transit Safety and Security Program (TSSP) Certification.Public Transportation Safety Certification (PTSCTP) Certification.Additional years of experience in the transportation industry.Possession of a World Safety Organization (WSO) Certificate or equivalent.


Job Conditions:

Ability to effectively read, comprehend, communicate, and respond to instructions, orders, signs, notices, inquiries, etc. in EnglishAbility to provide internal and external customers with courteous and professional experiencesAbility to work effectively independently and as part of a team (or supervise, if required)Ability to uphold the rights and interests of the MBTA while building and maintaining effective relationships with employees and co-workersAbility to adhere to rules, regulations, collective bargaining agreements (if applicable), and policies of the MBTA, including the EEO, anti-discrimination, anti-harassment, and anti-retaliation policiesHave a satisfactory work record for the two (2) years immediately prior to the closing date of this posting (unless if recent graduate), including overall employment, job performance, discipline, and safety records (infractions and/or offenses occurring after the closing of the posting and before the filling of a vacancy may preclude a candidate from consideration for selection)Ability to pass a Criminal Offender Record Information (CORI) check, comprehensive background screening, and medical Clinic screening, potentially including a physical examination and drug and alcohol screeningsAbility to work all shifts and / or locations assigned, directed, or necessary for this position, including (for some transit / operations roles) up to twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week as necessary to accommodate severe weather conditions, emergencies, or any other circumstances that may potentially impact service or the safety of service


Disclaimers and Definitions:

 General Disclaimer: The statements contained in this job description are intended to describe a summary, general nature, and complexity of typical job functions and do not represent an exhaustive list of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities required of staff assigned to this position. Application Deadlines: Applicants should apply as soon as possible, as the MBTA may stop considering applicants after a sufficiently large applicant pool is established. Work Environment: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here-in are representative of those an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. See job description for role-specific requirements. Work Eligibility: Although the MBTA is an Equal Opportunity Employer, all employees must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer and on an unrestricted basis (the MBTA does not sponsor non-US citizens). However, if you have an unrestricted work authorization, or sponsored by a separate entity, you are welcome to apply for open positions. International students taking part in CPT / STEM / OPT programs through a university are eligible for internships and co-ops with the MBTA. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to complete a Form I-9 to verify their identity and eligibility to work in the U.S. Interviews: Candidates should ensure they arrive on time, are prepared, can remain for the duration, and if remote, are in a quiet place without distraction, for the interview. Candidates who do not attend their interview without advance authorization, including an email confirmation of a rescheduled time/date from Human Resources, will be considered a no-show and disqualified from consideration for the position. Related to rescheduling, on a one-time basis, and due to something emergent, you may be allowed to reschedule the interview. In addition, Human Resources may require documentation supporting the request. However, should you need to reschedule, you will need to contact your Recruiter directly by email. Safety Sensitive Positions: Employees working in this classification will be subject to periodic physical examinations plus random drug and alcohol testing. On-call or 24/7 Positions: Employees working in this classification must be available to respond to page / text / call and report to work as determined by assigned department or the Authority. Essential / Emergency Staff: During declared "states of emergency," employees working in this classification are required to report to work for their assigned work hours or as directed by management. ADA Accommodations: The MBTA makes reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you require an accommodation during this process, please contact the MBTA's ADA Unit at 617-222-5751 or hradaaa@mbta.com . Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: The MBTA is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer . For terms, descriptions, and definitions related to diversity, equity, inclusion, veteran status, and immediate family members that you may find on the application form, please visit mbta.com/careers-app-definitions .

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Vignet, Inc., d/b/a Vibrent Health , headquartered in Fairfax, Virginia, seeks a work-at-home Senior Software Engineer (with the ability to telecommute with appropriate telecommuting systems) responsible for developing Vibrent Health’s digital health technology and research tools, particularly with respect to software delivery using Agile Software development methodologies.

Specific duties of this position include: (i) participating in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including design, software development and code reviews; (ii) supporting the product owners and Scrum Master in maintaining a well-groomed and organized backlog; (iii) ensuring all new code is properly reviewed using code review tools and best practices; (iv) facilitating the adoption of new frameworks and technology capabilities; (v) evaluating and implementing new open source/cloud native tools and technologies, as needed; and (vi) solving complex technical problems and design issues and initiating code refactoring or design change as needed.

Must have a bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or a directly related field plus 5 years of experience in a directly related position.

Must also have five (5) years of experience with each of the following (can be concurrent):(i) building applications of various design patterns (such as MVVM, MVC or Viper); (ii) programming and developing mobile applications utilizing Swift, Objective-C, SQLite, Java, and JSON; (iii) developing and creating testable features in mobile applications using either Mockito, JUnit, XCUITest, Quick or Nimble; and (iv) distributing mobile applications through either iOS App Store or Google Playstore.

Must also have knowledge of the following: (i) standards such as REST and/or OAUTH and their applications in mobile development; (ii) external integration iOS framework such as CoreBluetooth or HealthKit; (iii) Docker or Kubernetes pipeline tools; and (iv) mobile automation frameworks such as Appium or Webdriver.

Apply at https://jobs.lever.co/vibrenthealth .

When you work at Vibrent, you are surrounded by a diverse group of people who share a passion for achieving excellence and making a lasting impact. Passion, excellence and impact should be rewarded, and we do that-- offering a competitive compensation package that includes over-average 401k match, the benefits you need to prioritize self and family care, and support for your further education and career development. One of the greatest benefits Vibrent offers is opportunity.  At Vibrent, we work with the latest tools and technologies including enterprise mobile apps, fitness sensors, medical devices, cloud computing, machine learning, big data and analytics. We partner with national leaders in healthcare, technology, and research. We create tools that will change and improve healthcare for ourselves and future generations.

Vibrent is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.

title: Territory Account Manager
description:
EquipmentShare is Hiring a Territory Account Manager

EquipmentShare is searching for a Territory Account Manager for our rental facility in Williston, ND to support our team as it continues to grow.

EquipmentShare is seeking a Territory Account Manager to be responsible for expanding our existing customer base by building relationships with contractors and construction company principals.

Primary Responsibilities

Quickly respond to inbound leads and requestsExpand our existing customer base by building relationships with contractors and construction company principals. Tell them about the numerous ways EquipmentShare can help save them money, make more money and operate more efficiently. In other words, educate them on how EquipmentShare solves their problems!Maintain and nurture existing customer relationships to ensure our customers are 100 percent satisfied with the level of service and support they receive from EquipmentShare. title: Director of HR and People Operations
description: Acre is proud to be partnered with ImpactAssets, a trailblazing impact investor that is dedicated to changing the trajectory of our planet's future and improving the lives of all people. Since their founding in 2010, they have raised $3B+ in funds which are being deployed in a variety of ways to tackle challenging issues in climate solutions, racial equity, gender equality, and more. We are looking for a Director of HR and People Operations to usher them into their new phase of growth. If you are an entrepreneurial HR leader with experience in the financial services industry and a passion for driving global change, please read the job description below: SummaryAs the Director of HR and People Operations, you will play a pivotal role in driving the growth and success of our organization by leading our human resources function and managing a small team of specialized HR professionals to operationalize HR programs and services. You will be responsible for developing and implementing HR strategies and programs that align with our business objectives and support our ambitious growth plans. This role spans tactical to strategic, owning and administering the HR function end-to-end while supporting internal partners to facilitate organization growth and achievement of goals. This role is key in guiding and contributing to living our values and embodying our People-First culture. Key Responsibilities:The Director will design and implement HR Operations, and collaborate with the Talent Development and Culture manager to operationalize People Programs as listed below: HR OperationsStrategic HR Planning: Develop and execute HR strategies and initiatives that align with the company's culture and support overall business objectives/growth plans. This includes workforce planning to ensure headcount growth is aligned with budgets and organizational capacity needs.HR Operations: Oversee day-to-day HR operations, including payroll, benefits administration, visa sponsorship, employee records management, and HRIS maintenance. Streamline processes and implement technology solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness.Talent Acquisition and Retention: Oversee the recruitment and hiring process, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding new talent. This includes managing tight timelines and leveraging outsourced recruiting partners. Implement effective retention strategies to attract and retain top talent.Employee Relations: Serve as a trusted resource to managers and employees, providing support and resources for career development, performance management, team management, and other employee relations issues. Leverages Clifton Strengths methodology.Compensation and Benefits: Develop and administer competitive compensation and benefits programs to attract and retain top talent. Monitor industry trends and evaluate the competitive landscape and create strategies to adapt to changing market trends to ensure that our compensation and benefits offerings remain competitive.Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws, regulations, and company policies. Stay updated on changes in legislation and best practices to minimize risks and maintain a positive work environment.Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: Drive initiatives to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion within the organization. Develop strategies to build a diverse workforce and foster an inclusive culture where all employees feel valued and empowered.Technology and Metrics: Own and evolve the people-related tech stack including recruiting, HRIS, and learning management systems to ensure integrated systems that scale efficiently as the organization continues to scale. Track people data and analytics to ensure data-driven decision-making, incorporating qualitative and quantitative feedback from engagement surveys, 1:1s, and other sources into creating effective people programs. People Programs OversightOversee the administration of People Programs, which are managed by the Talent and Culture Manager, ensuring alignment with company goals and values.Provide guidance and support to the Talent and Culture Manager in the design and implementation of employee training, development programs, and initiatives to cultivate a positive workplace culture.Collaborate with the Talent and Culture Manager to coordinate employee engagement initiatives and recognition programs. QualificationsEducation and Experience:Bachelor's degree in HR/Business/OD or other related field of study required, advanced degree preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experienceProfessional HR certification preferred (PHR, SPHR or SHRM-SCP)10+ years' experience leading the People/Human Resources function within a high-growth, small to mid-sized organization. Non-profit or impact investing experience preferred. Knowledge and Skill Requirements:Experience working with leaders, providing coaching & feedback, demonstrating the ability to influence and build relationships. Experience utilizing Clifton Strengths framework preferredIn-depth understanding of HR best practices, with the proven ability to move seamlessly from strategy development to executionProven experience leading the HR function in a fast-paced growth environmentDemonstrated understanding of compliance issues, including federal, state, and municipal employment lawsExperience designing and managing a total compensation and benefits strategy that is competitive, equitable, and aligned with the company's valuesExperience working in an HR role in a virtual working environment requiredHigh level of integrity and ability to use good judgmentStrong skills with Microsoft 365 applications including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Teams requiredStrong skills with HRIS and LMS platforms required, ADP Workforce Now preferredProficiency with cloud-based collaboration tools Box and Asana preferred If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please apply directly here or reach out to Richard Kent at richard.kent@acre.com. ImpactAssets is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We know our organization is at its best when we include, celebrate, and embrace difference. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our mission, and where all can thrive and belong. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

title: Controls Engineer- Riverside, MO, USA
description:
Job Description

We are a global leader in automotive seating because of our people — a team of adventurous thinkers and passionate high performers who make it all possible. We pride ourselves on being at the vanguard of new industry trends and technologies. When you join Adient, you’ll play an important role in helping us improve the experience of a world in motion.

Job Summary

At Adient we a looking for a Controls Engineer who can develop, maintain and improve automation control systems integral to the production process of the assembly of automotive seating and overhead systems. This position is for either B or C Shift.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Participate in PFMEA analysis.Participate as a knowledge leader for Kaizen, lean manufacturing and other continuous improvement projects.Identify and implement error proofing requirements throughout the production process.Identify and plan for process impact as a result of engineering changes.Participate in 8D or similar root-cause based problem solving tasks.Contribute to specifications for equipment purchases.Support the maintenance department by assisting in the troubleshooting of equipment issues.Troubleshoot PLC ladder logic and data handling functions in Control Logix processors.Maintain PLC documentation upon receipt from equipment suppliers.Maintain archive of PLC programs throughout facility.Support various I/O devices connected to PLC’s including HMI’s, scanners, remote I/O, sensors, relays, solenoids, etc.Assist maintenance personnel in troubleshooting pneumatic circuits.Applies knowledge of electronic and instrumentation principles to determine equipment malfunctions and applies skills in restoring equipment to operation.Insure that abnormalities when observed are acted upon to resolve root-causes.Review and comment on equipment controls drawings prior to build approval.Maintain archive of machine controls drawings in an electronic and/or paper format.

Education And/or Experience

Bachelors Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field, and/or equivalent 5 years related work experience. Experience using Allen Bradley’s RS Logix 5, RS Logix 5000, ControLogix and Panelview development software is a must.

PRIMARY LOCATION

Riverside MO

title: Sales Director
description:

title: DevOps Engineer
description:

You’ll help architect our system for cloud-native environments while building tools to help our development teams ensure our features are highly reliable. Your role is pivotal—developing tools for system health monitoring, automation, and preemptive issue resolution to maintain high reliability and performance. Your contributions will be key in keeping Hum at the forefront of data-driven solutions, leveraging technology to power our growth and innovation.
Who we areHum Capital is the funding platform that connects great companies with the right capital. Our platform leverages the power of company data to streamline the fundraising process, offering personalized investment opportunities and insights. With over $650 million in committed capital raised for our partners across 2,000+ companies and 400+ institutional investors, Hum is making private fundraising efficient and accessible.Hum was founded by alumni from Stanford, Draper Fisher Jurvetson (DFJ), OakTree, Foursquare, NASA, Class Dojo, and has over 75 years of experience on Wall Street and Silicon Valley. For more information, visit humcapital.com.
What you'll be doing:Reducing toil and providing self-service & automated solutions for application teams.Designing reliable infrastructure for our platform and services.Finding ways to support dev teams by providing tools for observability.Reviewing technical proposals and participating in core systems designs (primarily written in python and rust).Provide support on outages and monitor applications as we run and take care of them.
What you’ll bring5+ years of experience designing, implementing, and maintaining production-grade infrastructure.Background as a Software Engineer with strong CS fundamentals. Experience with Python and Rust preferred.Ability to troubleshoot applications and provide advice to developers.Strong experience with CI/CD Pipelines.Knowledge of data-oriented applications and tools.Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, AWS or other cloud providers.Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform, Pulumi, and Cloudformation and their trade-offs.
Preferred Experience and SkillsPreferred experience with SOC2, CCPA, GDPR, and/or PCI-compliant systems.A collaborative attitude, clear communication, exceptional time management, and organization skills, all of which enhance teamwork and project success.ContainersInfrastructure as code (Pulumi, Terraform, Ansible, Salt, Puppet)Hashicorp StackCloud native applicationsCloud providersProvisioning ToolsPythonRustInfrastructure EngineerSRESoftware DevelopmentDistributed Systems
Annual Salary The expected salary range for this position is $175K - $200K.
Our cultureRemote-first company: We appreciate our awesome team and value open communication! We kindly ask all staff to be available through phone, email, or our designated messaging platform during the agreed-upon work schedule. This might mean aligning your working hours with your supervisor, regardless of your location or time zone. High Context Start-up: We operate as a high-context startup, where our foundation rests on the profound significance of shared understanding and direct communication. In our dynamic environment, we prioritize ownership, encouraging each team member to take responsibility and contribute to our shared success. Effective collaboration hinges on a deep sense of trust within our team.
Perks/benefitsFully funded medical coverageFlexible PTO policyHybrid work environmentHum offers a flexible work policy that allows for remote or in-person environmentsLaptopPaid parental leave
How we are differentAt Hum, we are a team of passionate people that hire under equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We love to boost a transparent and trustful culture of belonging and inclusiveness. All people have the opportunity to speak up and participate, grow, and share ideas. If you believe you would add value to our team but you don’t meet all the criteria in this job description, we strongly encourage you to still apply and tell us what value that would be.

title: Medical Device Sales Representative
description:
MEDICAL DEVICE SALES 

Position SummaryThe Urology Sales Rep/Manager establishes, builds, and maintains professional relationships with Physicians, Practice owners, Practice Manager, Staff and effectively communicates UroViu’s value proposition to all stakeholders. As an integral member of the Sales team, this position partners with cross-functional teams to communicate current market conditions and develop accounts to adopt the UroViu Platform. This position requires thorough knowledge of the endoscopy field, a demonstrated track record of launching disruptive technologies in the medical device space, and the ability to work independently.
SM Sales Territory - Cincinnati, Louisville, Indianapolis 
Principal Responsibilities
Meet or exceed quarterly sales quota for the defined area.Maintain a monthly and quarterly territory plan that outlines territory sales objectives and areas of opportunity.Provide monthly forecasts.Effectively communicate UroViu’s value proposition to customers.Qualify, train, assess, and ultimately develop accounts to adopt the UroViu Platform as an integral part of their Cystoscopy practice with the goal of demonstrating high account adoption.Communicate current market conditions and recommend improvements to the commercial process.Partner with UroViu Clinical Education to deliver outstanding clinical and training support to ensure physicians quickly become clinically independent.Build and maintain relationships with key customers and KOLs within defined regions.Partner closely with the Sales team, Marketing team and VP of Sales to identify and prioritize customers for higher-level corporate relationships.Provide support for the resolution of product complaints and/or safety issues.Proactively support organizational goals and objectives, policies and procedures, Good Manufacturing Practices, and FDA regulations, including strict compliance with UroViu’s Customer Relationship and the Sunshine Act policies.Maintain a professional and credible image with key physicians, consultants, suppliers, and teammates.Establish and maintain credentials (via RepTrax, Vendormate, etc) to enter and work in hospitals and other medical facilities as required by facility requirements.Manage travel and expenses per approved budget.Perform other duties as assigned.Contribute to our culture of being collaborative, respectful, transparent, ethical, efficient, and high-achieving.Work in the CRM database to input lead information and managing reporting on lead potential/performance

Education / Experience Requirements
BS/BA in Business (or related discipline); or equivalent experience.At least 5 years of related experience.
Specialized Skills / Other Requirements
Thorough knowledge of the field of urology and urology products, and strong relationships with local urologists are highly desired.Office and OR experience preferred.Medical Device experience required.Successful track record of launching new and disruptive technologies.Strong track record of over-delivering revenue versus sales plan.Strong written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills.Excellent negotiating skills with the ability to adapt to changing work priorities and maintain good working relationships.Strong analytical capabilities to refine business plans and sales techniques continuously with the goal of achieving maximum performance.Ability to work independently.Ability and willingness to travel approximately 40-60% of the time.Valid driver’s license issued by residing state and good driving record.Overnight travel required.
ABOUT UROVIUUroViu Corporation’s mission is to revolutionize the cystoscopy platform for improved patient care and efficiency and has operations in California and Washington and production facilities in Asia. UroViu is the developer of the always ready cystoscopy platform, the most portable, self-contained and versatile single-use cystoscopy solution on the market. The intuitive portable platform and product suite are protected by a portfolio of 13 granted and many more pending patents. UroViu's vision is to simplify the scope of patient care.
ABOUT THE PLATFORMThis is the most portable, self-contained, and versatile single-use cystoscopy solution on the market. Single-use cystoscopy not only allows practices to streamline office workflow and improve clinical efficiency but ensures higher patient safety and eliminates costly and time-consuming reprocessing. The intuitive portable platform, which includes three FDA cleared cystoscopes, optimized for diagnostic and interventional urology procedures, eliminates the need for dedicated procedure rooms, capital investments, and service contracts allowing cystoscopic procedures to be performed in any room at any time. UroViu's innovations ranging from patient-friendly design, physician convenience and comfort, to best in class optical and video performance, are helping busy practices improve efficiency and patient care.

title: Equipment Engineer
description:
Remote role with up to 50% travel depending on capital projects and business needs.Exempt Pay $130,000 - $150,000 DOE
Local Bounti is a leading controlled environment agriculture (CEA) company. Our mission is to bring our farm to your kitchen and deliver the freshest, locally-grown produce in the fewest food miles possible.
Our mission is rooted in sustainability and in turn human welfare. 
By growing local we help eliminate food waste and provide fresh, high-quality produce. Our sustainable greenhouse technology delivers ideal growing conditions for each of our crops, resulting in 90% less water consumption and 95% less land use than conventional agriculture, no need for herbicides or pesticides, and the lowest carbon footprint in the industry.

Local Bounti employees are empowered, valued, and respected. They have a passion for their work and for Local Bounti’s success. This shared passion for achievement is the lifeblood of our company.

Job Summary:As an Equipment Engineer, you'll be pivotal in maintaining the seamless functionality, upkeep, and enhancement of packaging equipment at our various sites. Your primary duties will encompass overseeing the installation, fine-tuning, and calibration of a range of cutting-edge machinery including Multihead Weighers, Fillers, and Sealing Machines from top brands such as Ishida, Yamato, Multivac, and ProSeal.
In addition to this, you'll take charge of training and establishing robust safety protocols and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for our maintenance teams. Your role will entail hands-on troubleshooting and repair of these sophisticated systems, coupled with close collaboration with cross-functional teams to pinpoint areas for refinement and spearhead the implementation of innovative solutions aimed at augmenting equipment performance and reliability. 
Duties/Responsibilities:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The duties listed below are representative of the essential functions, qualifications, physical demands, and the work environment encountered in this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with any other duties as assigned: 
Equipment Maintenance and Repair:Spearhead the design, procurement, and negotiation of equipment for capital projects, ensuring optimal functionality and cost-effectiveness.Collaborate with on-site maintenance teams to execute installation, training, diagnosis, and troubleshooting of equipment, conducting thorough root cause analyses to swiftly rectify malfunctions and maintain regular maintenance schedules.Liaise with external vendors or contractors for specialized repairs or maintenance tasks when necessary, ensuring seamless coordination and timely resolution. 
Equipment Installation and Calibration:Lead the oversight of equipment installation, setup, and calibration processes, meticulously verifying proper functionality and alignment with operational standards.Develop and uphold comprehensive installation procedures and documentation, streamlining the onboarding process for new equipment and ensuring adherence to quality standards.
Performance Monitoring and Optimization:Monitor key performance metrics of equipment and conduct systematic evaluations to pinpoint areas for optimization and efficiency enhancements.Collaborate closely with process engineering teams to implement strategic modifications or upgrades to equipment systems, bolstering performance and reliability.Harness advanced data analysis techniques to detect trends, patterns, and potential issues, proactively addressing them to forestall operational disruptions.
Compliance and Documentation:Ensure unwavering compliance with regulatory mandates, industry benchmarks, and company directives pertaining to equipment operation, maintenance, and safety.Establish and uphold Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to empower Facilities Maintenance in maintaining accurate records of equipment maintenance activities, repairs, and calibration procedures, meticulously adhering to documentation protocols.
Training and Knowledge Transfer:Deliver comprehensive training and mentorship to maintenance technicians and operational personnel on equipment operation, maintenance best practices, and safety protocols.Cultivate a culture of continual learning and knowledge dissemination to foster technical proficiency and expertise within the team, driving sustained performance excellence.Any other duties as assigned.
Required Skills/Abilities:Embrace Local Bounti’s Core Values.Familiarity with preventive maintenance programs, reliability-centered maintenance (RCM) principles, and predictive maintenance methodologies, underlining a proactive approach to equipment upkeep and optimization.Exceptional problem-solving acumen, with the ability to remain composed under pressure and devise innovative solutions to address equipment challenges promptly and efficiently.Strong interpersonal and communication skills, enabling seamless collaboration across diverse teams and the capacity to convey technical information clearly and concisely to non-technical stakeholders.Meticulous attention to detail, coupled with a steadfast commitment to ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards and company policies. Bilingual ability in Spanish is a plus
Education and Experience:Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience working with Multihead Weighers, Fillers, and Sealing Machines, including prominent brands such as Ishida, Yamato, Multivac, and ProSeal, preferably within a commercial food production setting, with specific exposure to cut lettuce production highly valued.Demonstrated track record in equipment maintenance, repair, and troubleshooting in manufacturing or industrial environments, showcasing proficiency in swiftly diagnosing and rectifying issues to minimize downtime.Robust technical expertise encompassing mechanical, electrical, and/or electronic systems, coupled with adeptness in interpreting schematics, diagrams, and technical manuals to facilitate effective problem-solving.Experience with AutoCAD. 
Physical Demands:(Physical demands are a general guide and specific positions will vary based on working conditions, locations and facility/department needs)The working environment is subject to pressure for multiple calls, inquiries, and interruptions.Hearing: perceiving the nature of sound by ear.Lifting: raising or lowering objects weighing no more than 10 pounds, from one level to another.Mental Demands: mathematical reasoning, memorization, oral comprehension, spatial orientation, and written comprehension.Sitting: remaining in the normal seated position.Stooping: bending the body by bending the spine at the waist.Talking: expressing or exchanging ideas by means of spoken words.Vision Near acuity: ability to see clearly at 20 inches or less

title: Business Development Specialist

Report discrepancies in procedures and policy details to management, as necessary.  Maintain positive market image and focus action on new business customer satisfactions. This description is not and cannot be interpreted as an inventory of all the duties, tasks, responsibilities and qualifications required for the employees assigned to this job. Education and / or Experience: High school diploma or equivalent. Some college or post-secondary training in business operations or insurance is preferred. Minimum of five (5) years of related experience and/or training. Working knowledge of Guidewire platform. Must be detail-oriented and possess good interpersonal and problem-solving skills. Must be flexible and able to adapt in a changing business environment.  Must have the ability to keyboard enter at a speed of not less than 50 WPM. Basic knowledge and understanding of Microsoft Office Suite. Must be willing to work flexible schedules to support multiple time zones. Must be willing to travel for client meetings or training purposes. Must possess strong communication, organizational and teamwork skills. title: Crash Reconstruction Specialist-Trauma
description:
Requirements for consideration:Minimum Education:High School diploma or GED equivalent; National Automotive Sampling System training completed within six months of hire date.Years of Experience:5 years experience in crash reconstruction.Job ResponsibilitiesDevelops monthly and quarterly reports and presentations for the CIREN Program. Establishes and maintains a variety of relationships with outside agencies and consultants, in support of the project. Manages the Crash Investigation Sampling System (CISS) database in support of the CIREN Project. Perform Crash Investigation Sampling System quality crash reconstruction.Performs CISS quality crash reconstruction. Performs scene inspection requiring retrieval of physical evidence, location determination, ascertainment of vehicle(s) speed and travel direction, and measurement of road evidence (tire, scuff marks, etc.). Performs exterior examination of vehicles involving detailed measurement of damage and crush profiles. Performs interior vehicle inspection including examination of glazing, restraint systems, steering column, seats, and other vehicle compartment structures for precise documentation of damage extent, intrusion, and occupant contact points.Collects and records data consisting of written documentation and photographic evidence in accordance with CISS CDC Digital Photographic Guidelines.Enters appropriate and accurate data into the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration’s (NHTSA) CDAN single sign-on CIREN application. Prepares and submits a scaled scene diagram using the FARO Zone 2D program. Presents findings at scheduled case review conferences involving multi-disciplinary discussions concerning injury-producing mechanisms as required.Interfaces various Police Departments in the Virginia, Maryland and West Virginia area for support in data collection and crash reconstruction efforts.Other duties as assigned.

title: Admissions Representative

title: Master Planner
description:
We are looking for a FT Master Planner. This role is out of Provo, Utah. 
 We are seeking an experienced Master Planner to provide support, leadership and coaching to our supply chain team. As Master Planner it is an important role in the planning, organizing, and carrying out of large-scale projects. You will review data and plans to make improvements to the supply chain system. Additionally, you will be aware of stock on hand and actively monitor what is being used and support production by making sure they have the materials needed. 
We welcome you to join our team and be a Force for Good!  
 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Serves as a primary point of contact for and liaison with sales, manufacturing, and logistics. Collaborates with these departments to establish schedules and plans that allocate available resources to best serve customer needs. Create all Production jobs after customer sales orders are approved. Maintain the Open Order report tracking monthly and quarterly revenue Run reports of expiry dates and determine disposition to MDA or extend Schedule demand based on the product mix and provided accurate lead times to sales department. Attend and help support New Production Introduction meetings Assemble master schedule reporting regarding performance to the business plan, the shipment plan, the inventory plan, and the production plan. Manage load leveling and bottlenecks for more accurate scheduling. Establish, measure, monitor and adjust capacity levels to execute all manufacturing schedules. Determine available capacity before planned orders are released. Engage in capacity management during sales and operations planning and forecasting. Collaborates with purchasing to periodically compare current and anticipated orders with available inventory of raw materials; uses judgment to anticipate demand for and communicate additional supplies needed. Integrates sales orders with master schedule; coordinates availability of equipment and staff as needed to meet delivery dates. Alerts appropriate staff of master schedule changes or delays. Participates in periodic forecasting meetings with sales and other related departments; leads additional planning meetings with sales, purchasing, production, and shipping. Plans/recommends changes in capacity to hit target levels. Sets up and maintains work center and work groups in ERP system. Other duties as assigned. 

Knowledge/Competencies/Skill Qualifications:  Experience managing and improving supply chain data, information, and processes. Actively seek to improve all aspects of the supply chain by streamlining steps Professional communication skills are essential Exceptional ability to conceptualize large-picture projects and foresee challenges and needs to be addressed. Top-level understanding of all aspects of supply chain processes Previous experience with Planning is essential. Experience working in and maintaining databases using Microsoft Excel and others relevant to company processes. Supply Chain Management certification and/or 3-5 years of experience is preferred.  
Elevate Health Sciences provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Elevate Health Sciences complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.  
Elevate Health Sciences is dedicated to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer! 

Our Benefits & Perks:
You will be part of an engaged, inclusive, global community that values family, giving back, beauty, and sustainability. We offer competitive benefits to eligible employees with comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage; supplemental life, voluntary short-term, and disability insurance; free access to therapists; a health savings account and 401k. You'll also be empowered to prioritize what's important to you through our vacation policy.

title: Field Auto Damage Appraiser
description:
The Crashbuster Auto Damage Appraiser is responsible for preparing physical damage estimates on vehicles where a claim has been submitted for first or third party damages. The candidate will be required to provide a high level of customer service while utilizing measures to control severities. Appraisals will be completed at residences, work places, and repair shops. This position is located in our New Jersey office with appraiser working remotely in their assigned territory of Southern New Jersey.

Essential Functions And Responsibilities

 Survey damages, prepare estimates and negotiate settlements. Settlements include partial and total losses within their established authority level.  Issue drafts to the appropriate parties.  Document the claim file as necessary.  Complete re-inspections and supplements in a timely manner complying with all New Jersey state regulations.  Comply with all production standards and estimating guidelines  Ensure that service, expense control and public relations are maintained at all times.  Complete reports on recovered theft and fire assignments.  Participate in team meetings  Participate in catastrophic claim handling when requested. This may include overnight travel for extended periods of time.  Adhere to privacy guidelines. 

Qualifications And Education

 College preferred and a minimum of 3 years of auto claims appraisal Exp.  Related claims experience or a thorough knowledge of automobile parts. and repair techniques, terminology and vehicle construction.  Must be organized and possess the ability to work independently with limited Supervision.  Must have a strong mechanical aptitude.  Body shop experience a plus but not required.  Territory – New Jersey Burlington and Mercer Counties  Must have valid driver’s license and favorable driving record.  Adverse conditions are encountered while inspecting vehicles. Candidate must be able to work outside in inclement weather and drive long distances.  Comfortable completing inspections of damaged vehicles including but not limited to crawling under and around vehicles, inspecting vehicles in tight quarters at body shops and salvage yards, etc.  Must be willing to participate in catastrophe claim handling when requested. This may include traveling to other locations, extended and weekend hours, and up to a three week stay away from home.  Must have a strong mechanical aptitude.  Body shop experience a plus but not required.  Must be organized and possess the ability to work independently with limited supervision.  Must possess solid communication and negotiation skills  Additional State Appraiser Licenses a Plus

title: Assistant Superintendent
description:

D.R. Horton, Inc., the largest homebuilder in the U.S., was founded in 1978 and is a publicly traded company on the New York Stock Exchange. title: Software Engineer III
description:
Our Opportunity

Chewy is hiring a Senior Software Engineer for our Outbound tech Team in Boston, MA. This position will have exposure across the entire supply chain enterprise, influencing the vision and implementation of architecture, design, and features that directly impact the company's bottom line. As part of a dynamic team, this role offers a tremendous opportunity for professional growth in the leading online pet retailer in the US. The role will have immense visibility in Chewy's technology & business organization.

What You'll Do

Technical Leadership and Architectural Guidance:Lead by example, demonstrating a deep understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices.Provide architectural guidance and design oversight, ensuring solutions are scalable, secure, and aligned with business objectives.Foster a culture of technical excellence within the team, encouraging innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning.Code Quality and Review:Establish and enforce coding standards, code review processes, and quality assurance practices.Conduct regular code reviews, providing constructive feedback to team members to improve code quality, readability, and maintainability.Implement automated testing frameworks and CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous integration and delivery of high-quality software.AWS Expertise and Cloud Architecture:Utilize your expertise in AWS services to architect and implement scalable, resilient, and cost-effective cloud solutions.Design and deploy cloud-native applications leveraging services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, and ECS/EKS.Implement best security, compliance, and performance optimization practices in AWS environments.Project Planning and Execution:Drive project execution, identifying key milestones, dependencies, and resourcing, monitoring progress, addressing impediments, and ensuring timely delivery of high-quality software solutions.Cross-Functional Collaboration:Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product management, design, quality assurance, and operations, to align priorities and deliver integrated solutions.Facilitate communication and collaboration between teams, resolving conflicts and fostering a culture of transparency and accountability.

What You'll Need

7+ years of experience in Software Development as a software engineerStrong technical skills in programming languages like Java, Python, JavaScriptExtensive experience with cloud technologies, particularly AWS, and proficiency in cloud architecture design and implementation. Hands-on experience with AWS services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB.Solid understanding of software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum) and tools (e.g., JIRA, Git).Solid fundamental background in multiple testing disciplines (e.g., APIs, Functional UI testing, Performance testing, data-oriented systems testing, distributed systems, etc.).Bachelors in Computer Science, or a similar math or engineering discipline.

Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.

title: Associate Director, Uro-Oncology National Accounts
description:
Job Description:As a privately-owned, biopharmaceutical company, Ferring pioneers and delivers life-changing therapies that help people build families and live better lives. Our independence helps us cultivate an entrepreneurial spirit and long-term perspective that enables us to achieve growth and scale, while remaining agile and true to our ‘people first’ philosophy. Built on a 70-year plus commitment to science and research, Ferring is relentless in its pursuit of science that drives powerful discoveries and therapies to help people build families, stay healthy, and stand up to the world’s oldest enemy: disease.
 
 Ferring is on a mission to transform the treatment of bladder cancer with a novel, first-in-class intravesical gene therapy that provides patients with an alternative to bladder removal surgery. Our Uro-Oncology team is growing with a variety of rewarding opportunities in commercial, medical affairs and technical operations. If you are energized by the prospect of bringing the benefits of cutting-edge science to meet the needs of patients, we may have the perfect role for you.
 
 As the Associate Director, Uro-Oncology National Accounts you will be a critical part of the customer facing team responsible for launching our new intravesical gene therapy. This role is responsible for establishing and maintaining Ferring’s relationship with premier national urology accounts and ensure the pull-through at the local level to achieve a best in industry launch. This position works collaboratively with key internal and external customers to achieve strategic business objectives.
 
 This is your opportunity to play an important role in making available to patients a novel product that has the potential to revolutionize the treatment of bladder cancer!
 
 With Ferring, you will be joining a recognized leader, identified as one of “The World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Fast Company, and honored by Fortune with inclusion on its “Change the World List,” for addressing society’s unmet needs. Ferring US is also Great Places to Work® Certified, distinguishing it as one of the best companies to work for in the country.
 
 Responsibilities:
Create Ferring wholistic / encompassing account plans for national urology accounts in coordination with sales, marketing, and other cross functional partners. Serve as corporate office liaison with these accounts and identify opportunities, diagnosis bottle necks, and pull in multifunctional resources as needed.Partner with business leadership and other internal leaders to create and translate brand strategy into a national plan of action with identified accounts to achieve increased patient access.Develop and complete account planning tools and resources/ reporting to senior management.Rapidly and collaboratively increase patient access with core targets.Analyze market trends and conditions to drive recommendations for business optimization and expansion with large outpatient providers.Create and grow relationships with KOLs and other B to B stakeholders to ensure maximum support and collaborationIdentify and drive collaboration with cross functional teams to benefit patients.Develop and manage business relationships at the corporate level c-suite.
 Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree; MBA or other advanced degree preferred7+ years in pharma or specialty sales in a management position with a minimum of 3+ years of documented success with national / regional accounts or systemsOncology and/or Urology experience requiredExperience in regional / national accounts, marketing, market access, analytics, training, or related rolesProduct launch experience is required.Experience with buy and bill outpatient facilities required.Experience with strategic account planning including tools, resources, and reporting.Demonstrated ability to work cross functionallyStrong communication skills, including the ability to present to C-suite level external and internal customersExtensive travel is required to perform job duties.
 Location: National (Field)
 
 Ferring + you 
 
 At Ferring, we offer competitive total compensation along with an exceptional range of flexible benefits, personal support and tailored learning and development opportunities all designed to help you realize your full potential both in life and at work. From working hours that respect your lifestyle, a culture that is welcoming and equitable, and the chance to work with the industry’s most impressive people, these are just some of the ways we live our "People First" philosophy.
 
 Our Compensation and Benefits
 
 At Ferring, base salary is one part of our competitive total compensation and benefits package and is determined using a salary range. The base salary range for this role is $185,250 to $271,700, which is the reasonable estimate of the base compensation for this role. The actual amount paid may differ based on non-discriminatory factors such as experience, knowledge, skills, abilities, education and primary work location. Additional compensation for this role will be provided based on competitive annual incentive compensation targets in the form of sales commissions - payouts are based on individual and geography/company performance.
 
 Benefits for this role include: comprehensive healthcare (medical, dental, and vision) with a premium differential, inverse to base salary, to be paid by employees; a 401k plan and company match; short and long-term disability coverage; basic life insurance; wellness benefits; reimbursement for certain tuition expenses; sick time frontloaded yearly of 40 hours, or higher if state or local law requires; vacation time for full time employees to accrue between 112.5 and 150 hours yearly in the first four (4) years of employment, and additional accruals starting in the fifth (5th) year of employment; and 12 to 13 paid holidays per year. We are proud to offer 26 weeks of paid parental leave, learn more about the parental leave offering in our benefits package here. For roles that are not field-based, Ferring has a policy that allows employees to work up to two days from home and three at a Ferring site, weekly.
 
 Ferring is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local laws.
 
 Join our team and your voice will be heard, and your contributions will be valued. If you love to come up with new ways to make a positive difference and see them through, you will fit right in.
 
 We are proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer (including Disability/Protected Veterans). We maintain a drug-free workplace.
